org.dgfoundation.amp.nireports.behaviours

Class FormulaicAmountBehaviour

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.dgfoundation.amp.nireports.behaviours.AbstractComputedBehaviour<NiFormulaicAmountCell>
      • org.dgfoundation.amp.nireports.behaviours.FormulaicAmountBehaviour
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Behaviour<NiFormulaicAmountCell>

    public class FormulaicAmountBehaviour
extends AbstractComputedBehaviour<NiFormulaicAmountCell>
    the behaviour of an entity which has value = formula(tokens). The trail cells get their tokens' values from V-reduction.
    When building instances of this class, one specifies the formula and the callbacks which combine tokens' values.
    The way to extract individual tokens from cells is hardcoded: each cell holds zero or one tokens.
    The token value of a cell is NiCell.getAmount(), while the token name is the String metavalue at key NiFormulaicMeasure.METAINFO_KEY_UNDERLYING_MEASURE.
    This class is closely related to FormulaAverageBehaviour (which is a simplified/partial version of this one) and NiFormulaicMeasure (which builds instances of this class)

    • Method Detail

      • doHorizontalReduce

        public NiFormulaicAmountCell doHorizontalReduce(java.util.List<NiCell> cells)
        combines multiple elementary cells into one NiFormulaicAmountCell. It has 3 functions to fulfill:
        • group NiCell by the tag of the enclosed cell and separate them into lists
        • call the respective reductor on each of the lists, thus forming the vars-values
        • evaluate the expression tree on the given vars-values and return a cell with the built value
        Returns:

      • buildCell

        protected NiFormulaicAmountCell buildCell(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.math.BigDecimal> vals,
                                          NiPrecisionSetting precision)

        protected java.lang.String extractCellTag(NiCell cell)
        extracts the token this cell is encoding
        Parameters:
        cell -

      • doVerticalReduce

        public NiFormulaicAmountCell doVerticalReduce(java.util.Collection<NiFormulaicAmountCell> cells)
        does vertical reduction based on a formula. This is a 3-step process:
        • collect the respective values from cells, grouping them by tag
        • call the respective reductor on each of the lists, thus forming the vars-values
        • evaluate the expression tree on the given vars-values and return a cell with the built value
        You might notice that steps 2-3 are identical to the ones of doHorizontalReduce(List)

      • getZeroCell

        public NiFormulaicAmountCell getZeroCell()
        Description copied from interface: Behaviour
        computes a "zero" cell, which is different from an "empty" cell. For numerical cells, this is a cell with zero. For textual cells, this is an "" cell
        Returns:
